rev.comment: rm gallery of fair use images per [[WP:NFG]]
rev.diff:
Line 43: Line 43:
In 2009 the [[Adam Art Gallery, Wellington]] staged the survey exhibition ''Billy Apple: New York 1969-1973'', covering the activities undertaken by the artist in the not-for-profit gallery he ran from 161 West 23rd Street.<ref>http://www.adamartgallery.org.nz/past-exhibitions/new-york-1969-1973/</ref> Later in 2009 [[Witte de With Centre for Contemporary Art]] in Amsterdam presented a major exhibition in two parts; the first ''Billy Apple: A History of the Brand'', surveys the artist's entire practice from inception as his own brand to the present day<ref>http://www.wdw.nl/project.php?id=196</ref>; the second, ''Revealed/Concealed'', focuses on his works that critique the site of art through architectural interventions.<ref>http://www.wdw.nl/project.php?id=197&taal=_eng</ref>
In 2009 the [[Adam Art Gallery, Wellington]] staged the survey exhibition ''Billy Apple: New York 1969-1973'', covering the activities undertaken by the artist in the not-for-profit gallery he ran from 161 West 23rd Street.<ref>http://www.adamartgallery.org.nz/past-exhibitions/new-york-1969-1973/</ref> Later in 2009 [[Witte de With Centre for Contemporary Art]] in Amsterdam presented a major exhibition in two parts; the first ''Billy Apple: A History of the Brand'', surveys the artist's entire practice from inception as his own brand to the present day<ref>http://www.wdw.nl/project.php?id=196</ref>; the second, ''Revealed/Concealed'', focuses on his works that critique the site of art through architectural interventions.<ref>http://www.wdw.nl/project.php?id=197&taal=_eng</ref>
